page.title: 13Religion St. Andrews Church
page.content: The Church consists of a Nave,Chancel and Bell Tower (parts date back to 1304 and North and South Aisles (added later on) with several stained glass windows.The Bell Tower has 5 bells,the clock and organ.No burials now take place in the small graveyard.The Vicar, Rev.Catchpole,conducts 6 to 7 services a week (about 100 people on Sunday),as well as Funerals,20 Weddings and 60 Baptisms a year.Although Anglican,about 100 Roman Catholics also used the Church for mass on Sunday.The main festivals are Easter,Whitsun and Christmas,with the largest congregation at Midnight Mass on Christmas Eve.The Choir of 10 consists mainly of Girls.The Church links the Community to God and the Vicar can offer comfort and help to the sick and aged.The Church also runs a Youth Club. Comfirnation Group and a Mothers Union.
